name: UploadPackage
helpMarkDown:
The *Upload Python package* task uses `twine` to upload your built packages to the [Python Package Index](https://pypi.org). You may also select to upload to the test instance.

Your username and password are required. It is recommended to add these as [encrypted build variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?view=vsts&tabs=batch#secret-variables) or a [secured configuration file](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/utility/download-secure-file?view=vsts) rather than adding them directly to the task.
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: distdir
inputs.label: Path to publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder or file path to publish.

inputs.name: repository
inputs.label: Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name or URL of the repository to upload to

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username to use for authenticating with the index server

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password to use for authenticating with the index server. To encrypt this value, use a build variable with its lock enabled.

inputs.name: pypirc
inputs.label: PyPI Config
inputs.helpMarkDown: The `.pypirc` file to use for publishing. If this file contains credentials, we recommend using the "Download Secure File" task.

inputs.name: pythonpath
inputs.label: Python
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the `python.exe` to use. By default, the last install added by either the Install Python or Use Python task will be used.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to install prior to uploading packages. Prefix with `--upgrade` to ensure you have the latest version.

inputs.name: skipexisting
inputs.label: Continue uploading when a file exists
inputs.helpMarkDown: When unchecked, existing files will abort uploading. Files cannot be overwritten on PyPI, and attempting to reupload a file will cause the entire build to fail.

inputs.name: otherargs
inputs.label: Other arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Other command-line arguments to pass to twine (e.g. --comment)
